page.title: 08Norton-Land Reclamation
page.content: Thirty years ago the spoil tip of Chatterley Whitfield colliery was over 90 metres in height. It was a conical shape and a train ran up the side to dump all the waste covering the valley. The coal mine closed in 1976. When it closed the tip was grey, black, smoky, steep and dangerous. It was very very dirty. It was decided to landscape the tip and Whitfield valley for public use. To tidy up the tip they needed bulldozers, earthmoving equipment to make the tip less steep. Then they got grass to grow and are hoping to plant trees. It is now used for walking, playing, horse riding and fishing in the ponds, that were once filled with black water. We have been up the tip and found fossils and bits of coal that have been left over the years.
